intro: Silene gallica var. gallica, commonly known as the common campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves and showy pink to red flowers. The flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, sunny locations. The plant is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
